author: obi0837
content: Hi I have a question . In a hypothetical situation is it possible to write a client node which mines only my transaction and save transaction fees ? I know clients like geth first submit transaction to mempool which is then pick by random miners which validate transaction . Is there a way I can bypass this process ?

author: potuz
content: Yes you could, and you'd have to be very lucky to find a block, but if you do, you could include your own transactions. No need to write your own client for this. Existing clients allow you to mine

author: obi0837
content: Why would I need to be lucky for this ? Cant I send transaction directly to my miner and then miner will broadcast that tx to rest of network ?

author: potuz
content: But your miner needs to mine the block

author: obi0837
content: Can I DM you to understand more about this?
